content.description: Let f(x)=x2 ,g(x)=cosx , and h(x)=x2+cosx . From the graphs of f and g shown above in Figure 1 and Figure 2, one might think the graph of h should look like the graph in Figure 3.
content.question: Prove that the graph ofy=x2+cos(kx) has either no points of inflection or infinitely many points of inflection, depending on the value of the constant k.

frqParts.text: Prove that the graph ofy=x2+cos(kx) has either no points of inflection or infinitely many points of inflection, depending on the value of the constant k.

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
